a94-1.resolution: wq-399 completed in B#342 (s1182). Root cause confirmed: s1178 truncated during Phase 2. Fix: two-layer intel checkpoint (e-intel-checkpoint.mjs + 36-intel-checkpoint_E.sh). Post-fix E session s1183 produced 2 real intel entries (not checkpoint-synthetic).
a94-1.metric_before: s1178: 0 intel entries, no trace, d049 VIOLATION
a94-1.metric_after: s1183: 2 intel entries, trace present, d049 PASS. Checkpoint safety net deployed for future truncations.

a94-2.resolution: wq-400 completed in B#342 (s1182). Audited both tools — intel-diagnostics.mjs (pipeline health) and verify-e-artifacts.mjs (per-session compliance) serve different scopes. checkpoint:true field added for R session filtering. However, R#203 directive notes still contain incorrect claim that s1178 was compliant. No post-fix R session has yet corrected the d049 notes.
a94-2.metric_before: R#203 notes listed s1178 as compliant — factually incorrect
a94-2.metric_after: Tooling scopes clarified but d049 directive notes not yet updated to reflect s1178 failure. R#204 (s1185) edited directives.json but did not update d049 notes specifically.
a94-2.followup_note: Low impact — directive notes are informational, not gating. Next R session may naturally correct when running directive maintenance.

B.note: Highest cost type — justified by commit volume.

A.note: Agent-reported costs understate. Session-history avg ~$1.80. Discrepancy is agent writing session-cost.txt before post-hooks add spend.

cost.trend_note: Avg $1.43 per cost-history (down from A#94's $1.53). 3 sessions used agent-reported costs which understate. Adjusting for this, true avg ~$1.60.

recommended_actions.description: A session cost-history entries using agent-reported source show significantly lower values than actual session cost (e.g., s1166: $0.14 vs session-history $2.40, s1181: $0.58 vs $1.52). The session-cost.txt is written mid-session before post-hooks and subagent costs finalize. This distorts A session cost averages and trend analysis.
recommended_actions.action: Move the session-cost.txt write to the very end of the session (after all tool calls complete) OR remove agent-reported source for A sessions and rely on token-calc only. The 15-cost-pipeline.sh already falls back to token-calc when agent-reported is missing.

recommended_actions.description: d049 directive notes in directives.json still contain R#203 claim that 's1178 all capturing intel' — factually wrong (s1178 had 0 intel). While low impact (notes are informational), inaccurate notes compound over time and mislead future R sessions doing directive maintenance.
recommended_actions.action: Next R session should update d049 notes to reflect s1178 violation and checkpoint fix deployment. Consider adding a note accuracy check to R session directive maintenance protocol.
